aaanalysis.CPP

class aaanalysis.CPP(df_parts=None, split_kws=None, df_scales=None, df_cat=None, accept_gaps=False, verbose=None)[source]

Bases: Tool

Create and filter features that are most discriminant between two sets of sequences.

df_parts

DataFrame with sequence parts.

split_kws

Nested dictionary with parameter dictionary for each chosen split_type.

df_scales

DataFrame with amino acid scales.

df_cat

DataFrame with default categories for physicochemical amino acid scales.

Parameters:

  • df_parts (Optional[DataFrame]) –

  • split_kws (Optional[dict]) –

  • df_scales (Optional[DataFrame]) –

  • df_cat (Optional[DataFrame]) –

  • accept_gaps (bool) –

  • verbose (Optional[bool]) –

__init__(df_parts=None, split_kws=None, df_scales=None, df_cat=None, accept_gaps=False, verbose=None)[source]
Parameters:

  • df_parts (Optional[DataFrame]) – DataFrame with sequence parts.

  • split_kws (Optional[dict]) – Nested dictionary with parameter dictionary for each chosen split_type. Default from SequenceFeature.get_split_kws()

  • df_scales (Optional[DataFrame]) – DataFrame with amino acid scales. Default from aaanalysis.load_scales() with ‘name’=’scales_cat’.

  • df_cat (Optional[DataFrame]) – DataFrame with default categories for physicochemical amino acid scales. Default from aaanalysis.load_categories()

  • accept_gaps (bool) – Whether to accept missing values by enabling omitting for computations (if True).

  • verbose (Optional[bool]) – If True, verbose outputs are enabled. Global ‘verbose’ setting is used if None.

Methods

__init__([df_parts, split_kws, df_scales, ...])

type df_parts:

Optional[DataFrame]

eval([list_df_feat])

run([labels, n_filter, n_pre_filter, ...])

Perform CPP pipeline by creation and two-step filtering of features.
run(labels=None, n_filter=100, n_pre_filter=None, pct_pre_filter=5, max_std_test=0.2, max_overlap=0.5, max_cor=0.5, check_cat=True, parametric=False, start=1, tmd_len=20, jmd_n_len=10, jmd_c_len=10, n_processes=None)[source]

Perform CPP pipeline by creation and two-step filtering of features. CPP aims to identify a collection of non-redundant features that are most discriminant between a test and a reference group of sequences.

Parameters:

  • labels (array-like, shape (n_samples,)) – Class labels for samples in sequence DataFrame (test=1, reference=0).

  • n_filter (int) – Number of features to be filtered/selected by CPP algorithm.

  • n_pre_filter (Optional[int]) – Number of feature to be pre-filtered by CPP algorithm. If None, a percentage of all features is used.

  • pct_pre_filter (int) – Percentage of all features that should remain after the pre-filtering step.

  • max_std_test (float) – Maximum standard deviation [0-1] within the test group used as threshold for pre-filtering.

  • max_overlap (float) – Maximum positional overlap [0-1] of features used as threshold for filtering.

  • max_cor (float) – Maximum Pearson correlation [0-1] of features used as threshold for filtering.

  • check_cat (bool) – Whether to check for redundancy within scale categories.

  • parametric (bool) – Whether to use parametric (T-test) or non-parametric (Mann-Whitney-U-test) test for p-value computation.

  • start (int) – Position label of first amino acid position (starting at N-terminus, >=0).

  • tmd_len (int) – Length of TMD (>0).

  • jmd_n_len (int) – Length of JMD-N (>=0).

  • jmd_c_len (int) – Length of JMD-C (>=0).

  • n_processes (Optional[int]) – Number of CPUs used for multiprocessing. If None, number will be optimized automatically.

Returns:

Feature DataFrame with a unique identifier, scale information, statistics, and positions for each feature.

Return type:

df_feat

Notes

The feature DataFrame contains the following 11 columns, including the unique feature id (1), scale information (2-4), statistical results for filtering and ranking (5-10), and feature positions (11):

  1. features: Feature ID (PART-SPLIT-SCALE)

  2. category: Scale category

  3. subcategory: Sub category of scales

  4. scale_name: Name of scales

  5. abs_auc: Absolute adjusted AUC [-0.5 to 0.5]

  6. abs_mean_dif: Absolute mean differences between test and reference group [0 to 1]

  7. std_test: Standard deviation in test group

  8. std_ref: Standard deviation in reference group

  9. p_val: Non-parametric (mann_whitney) or parametric (ttest_indep) statistic

  10. p_val_fdr_bh: Benjamini-Hochberg FDR corrected p-values

  11. positions: Feature positions for default settings

eval(list_df_feat=None)[source]
